metadata.title: CVE-2020-8608 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In libslirp 4.1.0, as used in QEMU 4.2.0, tcp_subr.c misuses snprintfreturn values, leading to a buffer overflow in later code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8608` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libslirp0 - 4.1.0-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

slirp4netns - 1.0.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libslirp package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.1.0-2ubuntu1').
slirp package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
slirp4netns package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.1-1').
